title: Signature-based prediction model
body:
# Implementing a Generalised Signature-based Model 

The 'signature method' refers to a collection of feature extraction techniques for multi-modal sequential data, derived from the theory of controlled differential equations. 

Lots of variations exist with many authors proposing modifications such as:
+ Path augmentations before application of the signature transform. 
+ Logsignature vs signature transform.
+ Method of rescaling (can impact training significantly).
+ Windowing operation (e.g. global, sliding, expanding, dyadic)

[A primer on the signature method in machine-learning.](https://arxiv.org/pdf/1603.03788.pdf)

[Application to prediction of bipolar-disorder](https://www.nature.com/articles/s41398-018-0334-0.pdf)

Studies have been conducted into the most important of these, for example:
+ [Embedding learning with signatures](https://arxiv.org/pdf/1911.13211.pdf)

and there is ongoing work (currently being written up) for finding the most important variations by examining performance on the UEA datasets. 

We propose implementing a signature-based model into the sktime framework that allows the user to set options for some of these most important variations and implement sensible strategies to choose said options through custom hyperparamter searching functions. The trained model will be output as an sklearn pipeline that takes in the raw data and performs:
```
classifier(post_rescaling(signature_transform(pre_rescaling(windowing(augmentation(raw_data))))
```

Computation libraries:
+ [esig](https://esig.readthedocs.io/en/latest/)
+ [iisignature](https://pypi.org/project/iisignature/)
+ [signatory](https://signatory.readthedocs.io/en/latest/index.html)
